dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3689454S] CEASE AND DESIST to songarea.com and videocure.com
dmca.body:
I have already called to clarify this request, but I am emailing to make 
sure there is a record of this.  I am not making a DMCA claim with this 
Cease and Desist.  I am reporting the deep-linking of our content, which 
constitutes theft of bandwidth.  Please process this claim accordingly.  
I am keeping the chillingeffects.org email address on here as well so it 
can be noted that this claim was misinterpreted by The Planet.

Thanks,
Alex Thurlow
Technical Director
Blastro, Inc.


Copyright wrote:
> To Whom It May Concern:
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.
>
> Please visit our web site at
www.theplanet.com/about_us/legal_docs/ThePlanet%20Copyright%20Infringement%2001%2015%2007%20FINAL.pdf
>  
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: alex@blastro.com [mailto:alex@blastro.com] 
> Sent: Friday, March 30, 2007 5:55 AM
> To: Copyright
> Subject: [ThePlanetAbuse-C3689454S] CEASE AND DESIST to songarea.com and
videocure.com
>
> ==== Forwarded Ticket ====
